definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: Our journey has never been one of short-cuts or settling for less.
sentences.chinese: 我们的征途中从来没有不劳而获或小富即安。

sentences.english: He set off once more in spite of his friends' attempts to dissuade him.
sentences.chinese: 尽管朋友们都竭力劝阻，他还是再一次踏上了征途。
在人生征途的露宿营地。

sentences.english: What supports wild geese flying all the way to the south?
sentences.chinese: 大雁南飞，征途茫茫，是什么在支撑着它？

sentences.english: After being opened, Zhoucun's commerce started its way of modernization.
sentences.chinese: 周村开埠后，城市商业开始了近代化的历史征途。

sentences.english: Walking in the new century journey, I filled with a thousand regrets.
sentences.chinese: 走在新世纪的征途上，我感慨万千。

sentences.english: I am a good person, how do I not right for you?
sentences.chinese: 现在征途好多区都合过了，你是因为这样才找不到吗？

sentences.english: I’ve always said that entrepreneurship is not a destination; it’s a journey.
sentences.chinese: 我总是这么说，创业并非目的，而是一种征途。

sentences.english: Demeter one of fraud do not know, once again embark on the journey around the East and West.
sentences.chinese: 得墨忒尔不知其中有诈，再一次踏上了东西逛的征途。

definition: lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to set foot on/to step on or into
to search for sth/to seek/to quest/to explore
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
to pursue deer/fig. to vie for supremacy
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 啟航|启航[qi3 hang2]
